title: 109_s1311
content: The Act titled "Bus Utility and Safety in School Transportation Opportunity and Purchasing Act of 2005" is cited as the short title. The purpose and findings of the Act are outlined in section 2. The "Bus Utility and Safety in School Transportation Opportunity and Purchasing Act of 2005" aims to address school transportation issues, particularly in rural areas, by establishing a Federal cost-sharing program to assist in replacing outdated and unsafe school buses. Millions of children are at risk of health problems due to exposure to noxious fumes from older buses, and many rural educational agencies cannot afford newer, safer buses. The Department of Education offers a Federal program to help rural educational agencies replace old, unsafe school buses with newer, safer ones. The Department of Education offers a Federal program to help rural educational agencies replace old, unsafe school buses with newer, safer ones. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, a "rural local educational agency" is defined as a local educational agency with schools in counties with low population density or designated with specific school locale codes. The term "school bus" refers to a vehicle primarily used to transport students to and from school or school activities. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education. The grant program is established. The Secretary will provide grants to rural local educational agencies for purchasing new school buses on a competitive basis. Agencies must submit an application with required documentation showing at least 50% of their school buses are in need of replacement. The rural local educational agency must provide documentation on the condition of their school buses, including mileage and reduced fleet operation, along with a certification of dedication to applying for a grant under the Act. The rural local educational agency must provide documentation on the condition of their school buses, including mileage and reduced fleet operation, along with a certification of dedication to applying for a grant under the Act. Priority for grants will be given to agencies with buses manufactured before 1977 or with a depleted fleet. The agency must also assure payment of the non-Federal share for new bus purchases. The Secretary will pay 75 percent of the cost for rural local educational agencies to purchase new school buses as specified in their approved application under the Act. Under this Act, 75 percent of the cost for purchasing a new school bus will be covered. Appropriations of $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2006 and necessary sums for fiscal years 2007 through 2011 are authorized.
